intro: Trollius sertiflorus, commonly known as the yellow globeflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its showy, yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are broadly ovate with toothed margins. Its flowers are composed of many small, yellow petals arranged in a dense, spherical cluster. Trollius sertiflorus prefers well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows.
